text:
From bottle.
Large beige head, very dark brown colour. Aroma: coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malts, vanilla. Lightly sour with dry/coffee aftertaste. Full body, long finish, lively. 
Very drinkable.
Another renown beer, eager to try it with friends after volleyball. My first St-Ambroise, a good one.

341ml bottle. Quasi black colour with average, creamy, moderately lasting and lacing, tan head. Roasty dark malty, chocolately aroma, notes of coffe and dark chocolate, fruity hoppy hints of blueberry and blackberry. Taste is roasty dark malty, hints of coffee, milk chococlate and dark chocolate, fruity hoppy overtones with a touch of blueberry and blackberry, overtones of rusty iron; smooth, soft, silky palate. Superbly balanced, harmonious, integrated. Wonderful!

Bottle. Dark brown, almost black opaque body, medium chocolate head with good retention and some lacing. Velvety aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, blackberry jam, dried berries and vanilla beans. Taste of well-done roast, herbs, burned caramel, dried berries and wood charcoal. Light, dry and soft. Outstanding brew.
Quite good and spot on to style. Slightly creamy character with plenty of coffee and dark chocolate notes.
C. Pours a black color with khaki head. I think its the coffee flavors Im not digging

11.5oz bottle - it pours a very dark coal water black with a thin off white head. The aroma is mostly roasty notes with subtle whiffs of chocolate, caramel, mocha and pumpernickel. Solid flavors of rich roasted grain, coffee, hearty bread and a hint of chocolate.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A pitch black beer with a medium coffee beige foamy head ; good retention ; ok lacing. Roast, cereal, black chocolate, light herb and some unpleasant notes I dont recognize (soy sauce?). Light to medium sweet, round, medium dry bitter ; quite refreshing. Good body, oily texture, soft carbonation, chocolate dry lasting finish. Overall, very good !

Tap sample at beerbistro. Black with very persistent yellow to beige head. Sweet aroma, like some chocolaty delight with vanilla and cinnamon; same goes for the flavour. A rather strong roasty character once you get past the sweetness. Very fine and rather inactive carbonation, dry roasty palate. Light to medium body. Soft. Slightly boozy even... like, really? A surprising brew. Im kinda parted. Not sure its up to the hype... No 9 of all Stouts and in the 100 percentile and all... BTW I only managed to have this on my 3rd stint in Canada despite the many tries... so Im especially disappointed... Will definitely try and grab a bottle when I see one. Id gladly up my score.

I bought this beer at amstein. I drank it at home with my wife in Lausanne. In my opinion, it is a regular oatmeal stout, easy to drink and refreshing for the style. The carbonation is regular for the style, nice black body color, brown foam, malt, wheat giving a side of sweetness, a bit salt like soja sauce, hop, a bit watery, dry at the final good relation with the price and quality.

Finally got to try this reputable Canadian stout at the Columbia World Beer Festival 2017. Poured an elegant solid black color with a khaki head, unleashed a quite unique aroma of tart, sweet milk chocolate with some roasty notes. Flavor is a fresh coffee roast with a more subtle chocolate accent, along with what struck my palate as some licorice. Relatively light mouthfeel for a stout, but with the signature silkiness of the oatmeal. Finished with a bitter coffee bean aftertaste. Thoroughly enjoyable, I will look for this again!

Pint can from Hollingshead Deli in Orange: drank on 8th Feb 2017. Poured into a Corsendonk badged stemmed tulip (twice): looked good, deep, dark and moody, the head a good tanned blanket of tight foam. Malty with the Oats coming through in the flavour, some coffee and chocolate esters in the nose: they also stayed for the taste part of the brew. Nice, easy drinking Stout with a sensible alcoholic content.

Bottle at Destins WOB. Great ebony body with a mocha colored head. A great beer, no flavors are overbearing, just a well balanced beer with hints of espresso and chocolate. Carbonation is not too intense leaving you with a highly drinkable beer.

341 ml bottle from Saveur Biere. Thanks to Werckmeister.
Black, oily body, with a medium, creamy, coffee-colored head.
Aroma of melting chocolate, toffee, vanilla, coffee, a banana like fruitiness, toast, some dark bread.
Tastes of coffee, spiced bread, dark chocolate, wood, toast, banana notes again, some liquorice.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes smooth, roasty, dry, wooden, with coffee, liquorice, some toast, slight spices.

Tasty! Perfectly balanced, very aromatic, but also pretty refreshing to drink for the style. Just the right levels of roastiness and sweetness, with a lot of diversity and some unusual, but perfectly fitting notes, like banana and spices. Outstanding style example, among the best Ive had so far!
Pours black with a thick mocha head. Aroma is rich chocolate, and roasted coffee. Malty, chocolate, coffee, milk and ash flavours. Full bodied and smooth, very nice.

Excellent! I liked everything about this one and found it quite a surprise in every way. I simply wasnt expecting much but it blew me away. Aroma is over the top so I knew it would make my mouth sing...the malt comes through nicely as such a great compliment to the espresso.
Smooth, delicious malt and intensely creamy. This might be the best oatmeal stout I have ever had. I love it.

16 oz can poured. Pours a thick jet black with a blanket of tan foam head and lacing. A both sweet and toasty malt aroma. Flavor is initially on the sweeter side. A good roasted malt, soft spice. A big hit of espresso like bitterness. Thick milk chocolate, and a resting roasted malt late palate. A stout that I feel like I can drink all day. Very tasty. I enjoy the subtle bitterness that sits with this stout. Interesting, and very well made.

Pours almost black, fairly large and lacey mocha head. Toasty aroma of coffee, chocolate, butter tart; noticeable oatmeal presence - very smooth. Taste is creamy dairy, chocolate, coffee flavors; some cherry, brown sugar, slight smoke. Nice hefty body. It isnt particularly unique, its just well made.

Bottle pour into nonic pint glass from Cigarette City. Appearance is only slightest of red with light source directly behind, otherwise opaque black, with finger-width foamy light brown head with poor retention and minimal sudsy lacing. Aroma is sweet roasted malt like dark fruit with toffee, bakers chocolate, creamy oats and vanilla. Taste is sweet over bitter roasted malt with dark fruit, toffee, molasses, vanilla, bakers chocolate, mild ash. Palate is light-to-medium bodied with thin, smooth texture, average carbonation and lingering finish as taste. Overall, didnt get the long-lasting head nor the espresso, and its a bit thinner than Id like, but this was quite enjoyable just the same.

Pours a dark brown with rich, tan head. Eggy, chocolatey, oatmeal nose. Weak palate and flavor profile. Not sure about the hullabaloo with this brew. Some smokiness in the flavor. Drinks like a Guinness--weak and lifeless.

0,33l bottle at home bought from Saveur Biere. BB 18 March 2020. black color, dark coffee-colored head. smells of yoghurt, light vanilla, spices, caramel, licorice, bit dusty. yoghurt is only for a second noticeable, afterwards some nice sweet vanilla/caramel notes come through. overall nice smell. medium body, light carbonation, rather thin moutfeel (for a stout anyway). tastes of vanilla, licorice, earthy notes, caramel, some ash, some yoghurt notes again, spices. finishes lightly roasty / dry with notes of vanilla, licorice and light yoghurt. overall good stuff, the yoghurt notes are a bit distracting, but not too bad. lacks a bit of body / flavour inbetween, which usually shows with age, but I just got the beers a couple days ago, and it says E2016, which I assume means bottled 2016. anyway, still nicely drinkable, and this comes from someone who does not like vanilla beers.

Looks good: ebony black, frothy light brown head, sticky lacing. Dry aroma has coffee, ash, milk chocolate. Medium body, dry, soft carbonation, bitter roast in finish, bit herbs. Nice one, balanced, good flavors.

16oz can from Foothills Liquor. Inky black pour with a soft, fairly creamy beige head. This is a straight up stout, big roasty grains in the aroma and taste, oatmeal sweetens it up a bit and provides some nice smooth texture. Finishes dry and ashy.
16oz can thanks to stevoj. Pours out black topped with a tan head. Nose is nice chocolate rich malts and some ash. Taste is more of the chocolate ash and nice roast.
Noire opaque avec une belle mousse café. Arôme de malt torréfié et de café. Goût de malt torréfié, café. Très légère amertume.

Damn good looking. Pours almost completely black, with a large, brown, creamy head that retains nicely, and plentiful lacing. Strongest smells are cocoa and roasted malts. Taste echoes that, with the roasty flavours really coming through. Goes down super easy with a nice, creamy feel and just the right amount of carbonation. A great stout.
Dark foam. Totally black, opaque. The canonical oatmeal stout. Thick and bitter but also sweet.
Black pour, huge offwhite head. Big roasted malt aroma, wood, black coffee. Cocoa up front, roasted malt, light char, woody, oats, coffee. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel.

Cest fort probablement la meilleure Stout qualité/prix que lon peut retrouver au Québec. Rôti, chocolat, café, corps métant apparu plus mince que je ne laurais pensé en raison de lavoine. Bien fait.

Can 473 ml. Pour in a 2 inch brownish white foam that stays for a good 10 mins. Its pitch perfect black, lighter light doesnt even goes trough. Aroma is of chocolate and coffee with a hint of roasted oat. I would have liked more that the liquid had been more thick and rich. Would have completed the beer perfectly. That been said, for 2,50$ its a real steal. I dont recall any other beer of that quality for that price.
Good fall back plan when theres nothing more fancy in a bar or a depanneur.
Canned. Dark body, huge brown head. The aroma has nutty and malty sweet notes, the flavour has a wonderful balance of bitterness and sweetness. Very syrupy.

Opaque black with no visible activity. Creamy light brown 2 finger head, lasting around 10 minutes, with strong legs.

Aromas of sweet biscuity chocolatey roasted walnuts, really nice. Flavors of coffee, cocoa, roasted nuts and almond, toffee, sweet grains, honey, herbal spices. Well balanced sweet taste coupled with a pleasant roasted bitter feel.

Smooth creamy medium body with perfect carbonation. Medium strength finish and nice intensity, ending with a sweet buttery caramel feel and a dash of lingering bitter spices.

Overall an excellent craft having delicious complex and pronounced flavors, very fresh, perfectly spiced and nicely balanced. One of my favorite sweet stout.
Great looking stout with a nice Guinness-like 'head rise' on tap. Not much nose to my taste but very well balanced body, great malty flavours and sweetness.

deep dark brown colour, large dense brown head, which lasts for several minutes; aroma of cocoa powder/dark chocolate, roasted and some herbal-floral notes; taste is the same; very smooth, very enjoyable!

La St. Ambroise Oatmeal Stout è di colore nero corvino, opaco; presenta una schiuma di colore marrone pannosa, di grande spessore, e di buonissima aderenza sul bicchiere. Al naso è semplice ma robusta, porta in dote aromi di malto, cioccolato, sciroppo, succo di amarena, farina davena e caffè macinato. Il gusto è sapido e molto ben equilibrato. Vi è un forte carattere di cioccolato che viene accentuato da note terrose; amaro granuloso con un 45 di IBU. La farina davena porta un po di acidità, note di prugna e uva passa si mescolano nel finale leggermente legnoso, accompagnato da un retrogusto abbastanza secco. Questa St. Ambroise ha un corpo denso e granuloso, da lieve a moderata la carbonatazione; una piacevole cremosità accompagna la bevuta.

Bouteille de 341ml. Dégustée le 7 novembre 2015 (Eng. pint). Bière noire opaque. Mousse peu, col mince beige foncé, éphémère. Peu effervescente, bulles fines. Odeur de vanille dabord, de café moulu ensuite, puis de chocolat en finale. Très douce, très sucrée mais pas sirupeuse ni trop lourde, un peu amère. Saveur de café brûlé et de chocolat noir. Assez consistante sans être lourde.
bottle. Black with one finger head. Big roast malt. Light smoke and anise, mild cocoa and coffee. Very well rounded, flavors all meld well.

Glass on tap at Balthazar. Aroma: licorice, candied fruits, chocolate, roasted malt, molasses. App: dark brown, huge mocha head, amazing lacing. Taste and palate: full body, creamy, smooth, medium sweetness, fruity, subtle bitter finish. Overall: something I always enjoy and for some reason never rated. Even better on tap. A great offering.

Pitch black, very nice head. Roasted malts, peppery, dark tea leaves. Full taste, hard roasted, bitter, characterful and outspoken. Nice body too. The oats really do it, I think. Good brew! (Bottle from Saveur Bière)
Bottle shared. Pours black with tan head. Coffee, chocolate, lactose, nut nose. Flavour follows nose. Full of flavour but a not overly complex.
Parmi mes classiques, les saveurs de pain rôti en finale viennent sajouter au plaisir des notes de café et de chocolat. À mon goût, tout est en équilibre dans cette bière.

Knocked back a bottle drawn from a mixed 10-pack from local depp/convenience store. Tastes like a proper stout with roasted coffee, chocolate and other rich flavours. Beauty aftertaste. This beer is a winter classic, been enjoying it fer years.
Dans le top des bière qui se retrouve dans toutes les épicerie et dépanneurs. superbe stout chocolaté et rôti. un classique qui fait solidement la job.
Ristet og røget i det. Næsten uden skum. Har en god lang smag af brænthed og noter af anis. God øl!

Az egyszerűbb jellemű stoutok általában nem gerjesztenek vad érzelmeket fogyasztóikban, jómagam sem kerülök sokkhatás alá egy-egy alapverzió elfogyasztását követően, mindazonáltal tud némi izgalmat hordozni a karakter akkor is, ha kevésbé intenzív jelleg hordozója. Ez a kanadai főzet márpedig semmiféle hordóérlelt jegyeket nem hordoz magán, elrugaszkodott összetevőkkel sincs megáldva, mégis kedvező benyomást tesz azzal, ahogy egy egyszerű stoutként is megállja a helyét. A voltaképpen unalomig ismert vonások, mint a pörkölt, pirított kenyérhéjas, kávés és étcsokoládés aromák, a süteménytésztás, kakaós, lágy vonalú ízjegyek jelenléte szinte említésre sem méltó, olyannyira egyértelműnek tekinthetők a sötét tónusok ízbeli megnyilvánulásai. Ami viszont mindenképpen kiemelkedőnek tekinthető, s ezáltal az én olvasatomban lényegét adja a sörnek, az a krémes és puha vonalvezetésű, lágy szénsavhálóval körbeszőtt test, mely visszafogottsága révén érvényesülni engedi az egyes elemeket, általa teljesednek ki a komponensek.
Bar none, the best stout Ive ever had and Im a stout drinker of 28 years.
Small bottle bought in BC Liquor store. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma is burnt malt and a touch of coffee. Flavour is bitter roasted malt. Highly drinkable. Very good.

A black beer, a head is medium and beige. Aroma has strong bready notes, some coffee and dark fruits. Taste is malty, mild roastiness, some coffee and dark fruits. More roastiness in the end. Medium bodied, no oats. Not a typical Stout, bready with the notes of fruits.

Pours dark red-hinted brown with a fast fading light brown sugar head. Aroma includes lightly roasted chocolate malts, oatmeal, toffee. Taste is slightly bitter lightly roasted malts, coffee, milk, oatmeal and again some toffee. Very solid and nicely brewed oatmeal stout.

Shared 11.5 oz. bottle. Pours an opaque brown-black with a two-finger lasting tan head. Looks fantastic. Aroma of roasted malts and chocolate. Roasted malt, chocolate, nut, and coffee flavors with hints of licorice and smoke. Not very sweet. Has some tanginess. Palate is a little bit thin. A solid stout.

Aroma: malty and sweet; quite delicious; hints of chocolate and coffee; Appearance: black pour with tan head and creamy bubbles; Taste: more bitter than expected; not sure if it works for me -- more like leftover, bitter coffee; Palate: heavy body with long, bitter finish; Overall: disappointing given the score; definitely prefer Founders Breakfast Stout.

It pours black with a dark brown head. As the head dissipates, there is a fair amount of lacing on the sides. It has aromas of roasted grain, coffee, a cream like quality, a slight butter quality, and mild oatmeal. It has flavors of nuts and coffee, completed with roasted grain qualities, oats, and a malty sweetness balanced towards cream. It is creamy with a mostly full body. It has medium carbonation and a moderately bitter finish.

Black color and huge head.
Aroma of toasted malt.
Taste is bitter with the 'coffee' very intense.
Great beer

1/29/16. Bottle at Bar Lusconi. Had this after a Founders Breakfast stout. Couldn't be more different. Thin head and body w bitter chocolate notes in nose and body. Hop and dark notes forward. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 0,33l. Pours black colour with a thin tan head. Slight coffee aroma. Taste has roasted notes from the malt along with some chocolate and coffee flavors. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Très agréable.
Un nez prometteur de chocolat et café bien ronds soutenus par des céréales torrefiées qui me rappellent la croûte bien cuite dun pain de campagne.
La bouche a une belle attaque ronde, assez épaisse, pleine de céréales, de chocolat noir et un fond caféiné.
On trouve ensuite une certaine longueur assez verte, plus amère. On déplore un manque de corps et de vraie longueur. Elle reste agréable mais vite oubliée.
Licorice, chocolate and coffee on the nose. Nutty as well on the tongue. Velvety smooth. Nice.
dark brown pour tan head, Aroma paste, wood, oats, coffee. Tastes char, oats, slight sweetness. dry semisweet mouthfeel. char is a bit too strong on this one for me.
Bue en bouteille 341ml. Couleur noir profond. Nez espresso chocolat. Au palais, super équilibre tout au long de la dégustation. Ronde en bouche, finale longue et goutue. Tres bonne bière.
Very nice and thick. Velvet feel. Roasted nut scent. Taste is heavy and wood, barley, nut, slight bitter but perfect. Deep black brown. Bottle

Visual: Pours pitch black with a small head, ringed retention, a few micro bubbles here and there.

Nose: roasted coffee beans, barley malt. (lvl-5)-pungency

Attack: crisp-half slick-creamy

Mid-palate: (lvl-5)-sweetness, (MAIN) full roasted malt -> light-med sour tangy bite

Finish: roasted coffee exhale, light burnt bitter, chocolate finish.

Summary: One of my favourite styles - a smooth and easy-drinking roasty malty coffee chocolate stout. A touch of sourness rounds it out, though I wished for a bit more creaminess and a layer of vanilla.

From Saveurs du Québec Bière noire pesante et bien savoureuse entre un Porter corsé et un Stout londonien lactique. Sans surprise cette bière offre un beau nez aromatique aux effluves de café fraîchement moulu, de sucre brun, de malt très torréfié et grillé avec un houblon fleuri. A lattaque, je reçois dabord des saveurs torréfiées caramélisées à la densité moyenne et au goût de café qui sestompent de façon abrupt au profit dun houblonage résineux assez franc qui se finit sur des notes rêches/acerbes à cause de lajout de maïs. Ce qui est bien dommage car cette finale nest pas à la hauteur des espoirs du nez. Rétro sur des notes grillées et argileuses. Très loin dêtre quelconque tout de même.#288
Black with tan head. Smells of hops and bitter chocolate. There is no oatmeal taste. Tastes like an American hoppy stout.

Many thanks to Chris for this bottle!  The beer starts malty and smooth, roasty and fresh. Not too deep but very easy to drink. Nice roasted sugar, not too sweetish. Easy to drink caramel, no bitterness. Great sessionable brew.

Pours an opaque black topped by a generous creamy tanned head showing great retention and lacing properties. Quite hard to spot any carbonation. The nose is smoky and woody. Some nice charcoal, faint dark chocolate element and dirty earhty hops. The taste is mellow dark chocolate but gradually evolves into lots of smokey charcoal. Long bitter finish pairing nicely with the dark chocolate. Very satisfying, but not for the faint of tongue. Cheers!
Draft in Toronto. Dark brown, creamy nitro head. Sticky rich aroma. Good roast, full body, touch sweet. But tasty and clean. Loved it.

Pours very black with a super dense light tan head. Quite a charcoal or smokey bouquet. Nice soft mouth feel and hints of chocolate but the more you drink the more the charcoal bitterness takes over. Long bitter finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Drank from a pint glass poured from a twelve ounce bottle. Pours black with decent beige head, nice aromas of roasted malts. Delicious oatmeal stout! Amazing complex with a nice drinkablity. Well done!

Tasted from draft. Pours very dark brown almost black with light khaki head with great lacing. Aroma is sweet with some caramel and toffee notes, a little chocolate and some nutty notes. Mouthfeel is super smooth and creamy. Coats palate and lingers. Moderately sweet with mild bitterness. Flavors of chocolate, roasted nuts, caramel, toffee. Excellent stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I must admit that stouts are not my favourite, but I had heard so many good things about this beer, and company so i decided to give it a try. Very dark beer with a kind of dark chocolate smell. Very thick. No aftertaste. Overall I wasnt disappointed. I would purchase again, but not on a regular basis.

MB
Bottle into pint glass. Pours a jet black with a finger of beige head. Aroma is caramel with a touch of roastiness. Taste is roasted malt with a touch of caramel. Really nice beer.

Si ça cest pas un classique! Servie dune canette à une pinte. La bière est noire (NOIRE). Jai essayé de faire passer la lumière au travers pour voir des reflets, sans succès. Ça fait un beau col de couleur café. Au nez, ça sent le café assez bien torréfié et le cacao. En bouche, on retrouve ces deux mêmes éléments, mais avec une amertume très intéressante qui vient sajouter. Ça reste bien en bouche!
Bottle at Epcot. Black with beige bubbles. Aroma of caramel, butterscotch, toffee, and roast. Super roasty and slightly sweet. Medium full bodied and pretty smooth. Nice stuff.

341ml bottle into glass. Totally opaque beer, only blackness. Thin tan head. Spicy smoky meaty nose. Zingy mouthfeel, solid body. Tastes of cocoa, dark chocolate, stewed fruit. Finish is subtle but lingering, like good dark chocolate. Very nice stout.

Marrone scuro impenetrabili con unampia schiuma beige frizzante. Splendido aroma di caffè e malto tostato. Sapori di cioccolato e malto tostato al palato, secchezza accennata. Molto be verità, buona carbonazione. Unottima Stout.

St. Ambroise Oatmeal Stout consistently beats out international stouts in blind tastings and competitions. This intensely black ale carries strong hints of espresso and chocolate. The oatmeal contributes body and ensures a long-lasting mocha-colored head. If you like stout, you will love St. Ambroise Oatmeal Stout.

473ml can via trade with Asheft, BB nov 2015.
Brune foncée, noire, col épais crémeux moka.
Arôme de malt grillé, rappelle un peu une root beer avec un grains en rétro suret, avoine note brûlée de malt.
Palais est malté caramel, grillé, café avec une bonne épaisseur de lavoine sur un fini houblonné noble rajoutant une amertume légère. Garde une fin davoine, café au lait, grains concassés avec un petit coté réglisse.
couleur brun foncé; petite mousse brune; arômes de café; goût de malt, café et chocolat noir; bière assez douce avec une petite amertume en finale (pin)

Can. Pours black with a thin tan head. Slight coffee aroma. Taste has roasted notes from the malt along with some chocolate and coffee flavors. I had this on tap yesterday and it was much creamier and better but overall this is a great stout.

A wonderful example of the style. Pours a nice black with lots of nice head. Aromas of oats, vanilla, strawberries and cream. Nice dark chocolate and coffee flavours. I even get some dusty oats. A great brew.

473 mL can. Opaque dark brown to black pour with a medium bubbly dark wet sand head. Some decent lacing. All the usual stout culprits are present, coffee, roasted malt, dark chocolate aplenty. Full body with a nice mild bitter finish. Taste really lingers in the mouth.
Tap. Pours an opaque dark brown with tan head. Aroma and taste of roasted malts, hint of chocolate, and some coffee.

Beautiful black body with a light brown, creamy head. Great aroma of chocolate and coffee, spices, moderate hops and a bit of roasted malt. The flavour, which is pretty much perfect, consists of coffee, chocolate and all the other stuff I mentioned that was in the aroma. The palate is very smooth and creamy. An excellent stout.
Very good level-entry stout. Delicious taste of chocolate and coffee. Nice dark color!

341 ml bottle. Pours an opaque, dark brown, almost black with an average, frothy, light brown head that laces. Sweet aroma of chocolate, roasted malt, coffee and a hint of caramel. Sweet flavour of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, oats and liquorice with a mildly dry, bitter finish. Medium body with a smooth, creamy texture and soft carbonation. An excellent stout.

Really a classic, with a thick deep taste unheard of at this ABV level. The Roasted malt and almost burnt maple syrup underpinning the classic stout elements of coffee and chocolate is a fabulous taste combination. Add in the thickening and sustaining capacity of the oatmeal and you have a best in show stout.

This is an oatmeal stout that delivers throughout the beverage experience. Mostly chocolate on the nose, but also hints of coffee and maybe just a little vanilla. Pours beautifully to a big puffy head that subsides at a pleasant pace. The body is amazingly light -- it just doesnt look like it should be so. The taste starts sweet but delivers just the most subtle bitter bite. And if it seems like this all just couldnt get any better, St. Ambroise (at least at my favorite beer store) is wonderfully underpriced.
Bottle. Black, frothy, brown foam, medium bitterness, light sweetness, light body, creamy, soft carbonation, & bitter finish.

"Its funny",I only bought this because I am too jet-lagged to get to a store that sells craft beer,and I had oatmeal for the first time in 35 years-2 days ago.
This is good,with a true/meaty oatmeal taste.

16 ounce can. Dark brown liquid with a dense rocky tan head. Roasted malt nose is redolent of coffee and dark cocoa. Bittersweet roasted malt flavor has more cocoa and coffee notes. Some dark fruit adds to the complexity. Full bodied and flavorful. Slightly chewy mouthfeel with a sticky finish. Very well done.

I had this beer million times. In draft and bottles. This review is for the draft/nitro version. The bottle version is also very good, but its a completely different beer. This is my reference for stouts. A very rich yet easy to drink/ low abv beer. I Love the mouthfeel, the robust hop character and the bitterness. The best / flagship beer of the McAuslan brewery.

I actually cant believe I dont have a rating for this as it was probably the only stout I drank for a couple years. Black with a nice foamy tan head, aroma of roast and coffee. Sweet and dry with roast malt, coffee slight vanilla. Yes
thick, sweet, and chewy, the second black, bitter, and gainy, and the third a weird tart, sherry like note. Pretty complex

Nice creamy but dry aroma. Chocolate and dark malt. Thick black/Brown color with frothy dark brown head. Creamy, with a bit of chocolate and black liquorice. Dry but soothing finish. Kinda like the aroma in reverse. Nice.

Poured from 12 oz. bottle at Coyotes in Banff, Alberta. 

Opaque, near black with a 2-finger tan head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of roasted coffee, roasted malt and chocolate. 

Taste of roasted coffee, chocolate, roasted malt and some dark fruit. 

Medium body and medium/high carbonization.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours black with a brown head. Aromas or malt and coffee. Flavors of roasted malt, coffee, and dark chocolate.

Pours with a beautiful lasting tan head of foam. Light aroma of malt and cocoa. Delicious roasty start to the taste which ends velvity smooth. I love this stout 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This was mainly drunk by my wife, with me sampling it. It is a joint review. 
A beautiful jet black body wears a mocha coloured head.
Aromas are of roasted malts and cocoa nibs. Nice dark chocolate presence. Oatmeal presence seeping out as it warms.
Tastes veer into the bitter coffee a bit. Actually a tad of red fruit peels on the swallow.
This isnt the best stout weve drunk, but it is solid across the board in appearance, aromas and tastes, and definitely worth a try.
Maybe st-ambroises best. This is a quality stout. the low alcohol level promotes easy drinking. Love it.
Mild nose and rich toffee and dark caramel flavors. Heavy mouthfeel and just enough hops to finish cleanly.

In the cool months, theres nothing more inviting than a good Oatmeal Stout. For the most part, St. Ambroise Oatmeal Stout hits all the right notes. While I didnt get the "long-lasting" head the description promises, I was pleased with the black color and brown layer of foam. This stout has aromas of cocoa, strong coffee, licorice, and cream. The taste was excellent with notes of chocolate, coffee, cream, black licorice, and spice. While the body wasnt as silky smooth as Id like for an Oatmeal Stout, it was still impressive. While I hold a certain English brewer in the highest esteem for this style, Id happily drink this Canadian option again.

Bottle.

A- Tobacco, roasty, smoke, soy sauce, coffee, cocoa, malty.

A- Black color, black liquid, brown head.

T- Roasty, bitter cocoa, subtle smokiness, malty.

P- Full body, thin texture, average carbonation, smokey finish.

O- I love it and yet I dont. The aroma is amazing but fades fairly fast along with the head. The body is thin and takes away from the overall beer. Not quite as smooth or creamy as I want for an oatmeal stout.

Cast wood aroma mixed with coffee and chocolate, light floral hints, pours black with a small off-white head, good balance of hops and malts, coffee and chocolate finishing with a lingering bitter aftertaste, soft carbonation creamy full bodied stout, excellent.

Pours a finger of tan head on a black body.
The aroma is rich: molasses, dark chocolate, coffee, roasted and toasted malt. Awesome.
The taste is pure darkness: black licorice, bitter chocolate, black coffee and a little salty smoke to finish.
The texture has a fair amount of fizz.
Its pretty great.
Strong dark smell, all roasted malt, very slightly smokey, touch bitter on finish, wish it had a less watery finish, slightest bit of licorice,

33 cl bottle, Calgary, AB, Canada vai RCLS. Didnt realize I havent rated this. I would say best price to taste ratio available in Canada. Cheaper than Guinness and one of the best non Imperial/Russian stouts Ive tried. Jet black, light brown head. Dark chocolate, raisin and faint spruce aroma. Great texture, smooth, not overly sweet, with a final bitter hop finish with just enough resin to balance everything. Great.

Extraordinary beer. I don't know what happened but I rated this here before and it's gone now. I loved it then and I love it now, Reuben James. appearances a light brown, big fluffy head with lots of lace and an opaque brown black color. Aroma is a very volatile blend of cocoa dark leather coffee yeast rum. Flavor is like aroma fairly dry some tobacco just enough carbonic tang. Excellent palate. I'd forgotten how good this beer is. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black stout with a nice dark tan head. Aromas of chocolate, coffee, some licorice, very roasty. Medium bodied, creamy but with quite a fizzy carbonation. Not too much sweetness in this one, has a nice dark chocolate flavor with some hints of black coffee, this bitterness is very present as well. Very good stout, for any time.
I was looking for this for a while. Definitely worth the wait. Very smooth and flavourful. One of the best Ive had in the style.

Purchased at Beer Temple in Chicago, IL; enjoyed on a cold Tuesday night at home. Appearance is a moderately thick pitch black with a nice light tan head. Aroma has a lot going on - roasted chocolate, licorice, oat, coffee, cocoa, very nice. Taste is real good. Equal parts licorice, chocolate, and coffee, finishes lightly bitter and rather dry, fantastic. One of the best balanced stouts Ive had yet.

12 oz bottle pours like black coffee with a medium mocha head and slightly oily lacing. Aromas of coffee, chocolate, caramel and leather. Flavor is mild to medium bitter with a slight sweetness in the finish. Tasty!

Stout à lavoine.mousse moka, effluves de doux chocolat,noisettes ,caramel et vanille. tres onctueuse,cest crèmeux léger pétillement,malt grillés chocolat mi amère, expresso mais pas agressif , douce amertume en final. délicieux!!!
Cannette de 473ml de stout. Arôme intense de torréfaction et notes chocolaté. Au gout on a une certaine acidité une belle torréfaction et des notes de fer. Meilleure de gorgée en gorgée

Still my favourite stout, of any variety. Rated from a bottle, poured into an english pint glass. Pitch black in colour, with a thin, café-au-lait head and slight lacing on the glass. Aromas of chocolate, toasted wheat and coffee. Smooth, creamy mouthfeel, not quite as heavy as some Imperials Ive had but more substantial than the Guinness yardstick and most other Irish stouts. Flavours of strong black coffee and bittersweet chocolate, some vanilla and sweet caramel hiding in the background. Hops show up late in the tasting game, almost there just to cleanse the palate. Low alcohol makes it very approachable. Really a wonderful stout, right up there with the best of the rest.

Bouteille de 341ml au Marché des Brasseurs. Robe de veuve avec un mince col de mousse moka très durable, à bulles de tailles variées. Arôme de cacao et de café torréfié, on sent aussi la céréale. Très crémeuse en bouche, elle ouvre sur une puissante note dexpresso pour finir sur une note de chocolat noir, amer, le tout sans jamais être agressive. Cest rare, une noire si sessionable.
Superb oatmeal stout. Dark and rich with a creamy mouthfeel. Plenty of roasted coffee character and a touch of sweet chocolate.

Silky smooth and inky black full bodied and just a bit earthy. This is an enticing Oatmeal Stout that ill come back to again and again. The aroma is more cocoa but the palate has a rich coffee roasty thing going on. The only hops I notice are hanging out in the background with just a touch of citrus/herbs. 

It has a sweet/bitter balance on the palate that reminds me of a Moroccan sidewalk cafe I hung out at in a previous life. My little boy loved to tag along and dip the over-sized sugar cubes in my shot of undiluted Moroccan style espresso. Dont know if that helps, but its sorta like that. 
And if youre wondering what a coffee saturated block of sugar looks like -- its the exact color of the frothy head on this wonderful oatmeal stout.
roasty, creamy, balanced. This is a superb stout with a tan creamy head and nice roasty creamy mouthfeel

"this is a wow beer for me, at least as far as the style is concerned. drinkability is a 10. aroma full and sweet, plums, chocolate, coffee, roasted grains. super smooth. looks great (black with a big chocolate head) and the taste is great too, matching the deep aroma. very well done. takes down the best oatmeal stouts "

Smooth and delicious. Dark black with a nice brown head. Smells of nice deep roast, chocolate, oatmeal, and soft coffee overtones. A bit of smoke. Nice smooth oily body. Creamy and full. Oatmeal gives it a milky smoothness. Rich and delicious stout. Tastes of dry malt, chocolate, coffee, dark fruit, and soft smoke which lasts into the aftertaste. Not so sweet and low abv makes it impressive for a stout. Imperial qualities at a stout level.

Pitch black with a tiny but steady coffee head. Roasted barley, coffee bitterness, dark chocolate. Taste is mainly sweet with a shy bitter aftertaste. Creamy texture, high carbonation with a dry finish

Smooth, chocolate and coffee flavours with an intense roasted oatmeal nose with chocolate and coffee overtones that is to die for. Love the initial taste on the Palate and the flavour lingers in your mouth. Excellent creamy head that lasts well. Nicest beer of this style that I have had, but it is worth noting that while I love a dark beer I find most Imperial Stouts too heavy for my palate whereas this was exactly the taste and nose I have been looking for.

Draft to pnt glass
Chocolate, light coffee, loads of malt, and wheat. Deep black, 1.5 cm thick creamy tan head. Toasted malt, bitter chocolate, ginger, a little lactose and some sourness.

Bottle. Pitch black, clear color. Thick brown head. The smell is great, chocolate, mocca, toffee, nuts, absolutely fantastic. The taste is light sweet, at the beginning and ends with a perceptible bitter note. Palate is fresh, with a medium to thick texture. Aftertaste has some more nice coffee and roast notes. 
Absolutely great stout, love it!

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2014 341ml bottle from The Only Cafe. Dark opaque brown/black body with thin tan head, nice lacing. Dark chocolate, espresso, roasted malt aroma. Thick heavy mouthfeel. Notes of alcohol at only 5%. Hops present on the finish.

Poured from 341 mL bottle. Incredible aroma of chocolate and coffee. Pours black with brown head. Definitely bitter in taste. Full bodied, slick texture, average carbonation, with a bitter dry finish. Overall a great bitter stout.

Pours an opaque black with a firm tan head. Looks delicious. Strong malt and oat aroma, nice creamy espresso and chocolate. Toffee and molasses amongst the flavours. Creamy mouthfeel and dry finish. Hard to achieve, but works brilliantly

341ml bottle from LCBO, Parkway Mall, Scarborough, ON. 5% Alc. / vol. Pours an opaque dark brown colour with one finger of lasting tanned head. Beautiful lacing. 
Aroma of caramel, coffee and minimal notes of booze. Taste matches aroma with a dry finish. Medium carbonation.

Pours nearly jet black with only the slightest hints of deep cola brown around the edges, a fat finger of tan head diminishing gradually to a thin skim, and moderate lacing. Nose is coffee, chocolate, caramel, slightly smokey. Taste follows suit with a mild molasses sweetness tempering roasted malt and bitter coffee. Full body and low carbonation, with a creamy mouth feel and dry finish.

Now thats a stout - this is what Guinness wishes it was. (Yes, I once gave Guinness the same rating Im giving this one. That was then, this is now. Deal with it. Ill re-review a Guinness sometime and put it where it belongs.) Id love to have this on a nitro tap to really amp up the creaminess, but its pretty decent just as it is. The oatmeal definitely tempers the flavour, giving it a fuller, rounder aspect. This can rightly take its place as one of the best Canadian beers around.
Smells great with a hint of dark chocolate, smooth taste not much of an after taste. Those that like darker beers would enjoy.

On tap at the brewery terrace as part of a 12$ tasting set. A cola black pour with red highlights and a creamy tan head. Rich cocoa and toasted oats aroma. Smooth creamy body and a fairly full mouthfeel. The taste is quite roasty, a bit of coffee grounds, cocoa an toasted/roasted malts. Very nice, seems like a restrained use of black patent malts.

From 473 ml can. Pour is pitchblack with huge tan head. Nose is roasted malts with chocolate and dark chocolate notes. Some light caramel sweetness, too. A little metallic. Favours are again roasted malts with a punch of sourness. Long metallic finish with light bitterness. Pretty light body. Solid oatmeal stout, but I expected more.

Thought I would review an old favourite.
For a 6-pack with an MSRP of $9.99, this is a hell of a beer, and my go-to stout. 
It looks great: jet black with a frothy tan head. It smells great: coffee, chocolate, caramel. It tastes great: chocolate, caramel and a bit of treacle, with beautiful bitter coffee finish.
Certainly nothing revolutionary, but a really well-executed oatmeal stout, at a terrific price point.

Beautiful black pour w/ a big mocha head that leaves lacing. The aroma is a great blend between chocolate & roasted notes. The taste is quite similar as it mixes bitterness & sweetness exceptionally! It feels light & creamy on the palate. This is one damn good stout!
Une référence depuis tant dannées... Jadore léquilibre là-dedans; il y a juste assez de tout. Cest bon, point à la ligne!

Draft - Nitro - bitter chocolate and roast malts. Jet black with a rich creamy light brown head. Chocolate, coffee and roast malts with a creamy light bitter finish. Very nice as usual from these guys.
Can. A nice, well-balanced stout, the obligatory hints of coffee, nice foam and gentle finish.

Poured from a bottle that had a twist off cap. I did not expect such an amazing beer from that, but wow. This is what an oatmeal stout is supposed to be like. Color is jet black and completely opaque with a dark brown head. Aroma is smoky with roasted notes of coffee and chocolate. Taste is malty, but not too sweet. Nice slick and full mouthfeel. Great beer.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2014 Apparence: D?une couleur noire opaque. Elle est coiffée d?une bonne mousse d?une couleur café moka d?une bonne durée. Effervescence difficile à évaluer, mais semble quasi inexistante.Arômes: Au nez, ce sont des notes de malt torréfié, d?espresso et de chocolat.Saveurs: Au goût, c?est un corps moyen en bouche avec des saveurs de chocolat et d?espresso. La finale est dominé par l?amertume du grain torréfié. Longueur moyenne et aucune effervescence.Fiche technique Style: Oatmeal StoutFormat: 341 mlTaux d?alcool : 5%
Température: 8°C - 12°C
IBU: 45
Houblons: Cascade, Golding et Willamette

Bière de couleur noir débène, avec une mousse moka. Nez de café, de chocolat noir, de vanille subtile. En bouche, le café et le chocolat sont très bien équilibré, belle acidité également. Pas trop sucré. Excellente noire!

Pours a dark black with a brownish thick head. Aroma is lots of coffee and some chocolate. Taste is slightly bitter with hints of coffee. Aftertaste is dryer but no real bitterness or longer lasting one.
Bottle. Nearly black pour, beige head. Creamy, chocolatey aroma. Cocoa and malt in the flavour, simple but tasty. Medium bodied. Nice.

100? 100!?! A fine Stout but not "100" worthy. Where does that score even originate? I dont see literally everyone that has rated it giving it a "5". Ranting aside, it is a tasty example, a brownish black, medium carbonated slickster with a tan head. Very wonderful scent of coffee, dark chocolate, molasses, burnt brown sugar and leather. Bittersweet mocha taste with a smooth maple finish. A good readily available drinky-poo.

Poured from a tap. Dark brown color, medium tan head. Mild roasted malt aroma. Medium body with a nice roasted malt flavor and a medium finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Beerbistro Toronto na vycape
Este som nevidela tak nadhernu kremovu penu. Farba cierna metaliza.
Pri piti piva a vrateni do povodnej polohy sa na odliatej strane znovu vytvara pena. Takze v pohari stale zostava kremovost a pena.
Vona je coko kava. V chuti najdete to iste plus jemne kyso horku dochut. Celkovo toto je toto pivo velmi vynimocne. Dala by som si k nemu coko chese cake. Odporucam.

Tapped at the Beerbistro in Toronto/Canada. Overall: mind blowing! Spectacular espresso creamy thick stable 2 inch head. Black noble color. Aroma of roasted malt smoothness, some oatmeal. Taste is dark chocolate, coffee, mild tasty sourness, mild bitter hops in the finish. Very tasty!
As far as I know, Ive never had a Canadian Stout before. This should be interesting. After the initial taste test, I am in love. This is a Stout for all Stouts. Great job, Canada.

This is a fantastic stout and easily the best Ive had. 
Rich, jet black beer with mixed roasty, coffee, chocolate, bread and fruit flavours in perfect harmony. Very little bitterness but not overly sweet either and a nice dry finish with a smooth as silk mouthfeel.

Très bonne bière! Belle mousse riche! Arômes de café. Tout simplement excellent!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rating #9. Pours a dark oily black with small dark off white head. Aroma of espresso and chocolate comes through. Taste is smooth and tones of sweetness and bitterness shine. All around solid stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Une stout de référence. Elle est noir intense avec un col couleur moka qui persiste. Elle a une texture épaisse quand elle coule dans le verre comme quand on la boit. Un arôme de grain grillé et café intense. Un goût complexe de grain torrifié, chocolat, avoine et plus encore et le tout avec une bonne longueur en bouche. On est chanceux davoir cette bière disponnible partout au Québec!
Black pour from draft at bevo in old Montreal. Dull milk and oat taste. Lighter and easy drinking but somewhat boring. Session oatmeal stout? Would have again tho

Bottle. My first oatmeal stout and she still stands strong among others. Pours a beautiful oily black. Aroma is of coffee and roasted malts. It taste of chocolate, coffee, dark fruitiness and has a smokiness to it. Not as sweet as other oatmeal stouts, so it is a welcome change. Has more of a bitter smoky aftertaste as well. She is a fine stout in my books.

Bitter taste of espresso and chocolate mixed with the taste and aroma of oats. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured deep dark brown with an off white head. Aroma of dark chocolate, dark fruit, coffee and roast malt. Medium body, flavour of the aroma, pretty decent.

Bottle. Chocolate, hay, and roasted oat malt aroma - great. Dark brown-black with large tan head. Sweet chocolate and oat malt flavor - lightly smoky. Mildly bitter herbal/grass finish. Body on the lighter side. Very nice.

Opaque dark brown with minimal head. Malt, alcohol, roast aroma, but less vigorous than I would like. Mildly bitter roast chocolate with emphasis on the roast. Malt and cereal present as well. Dry finish. Although good, I personally prefer my stouts to be less dry.
Dark roasty malt, toast and char. Long and lingering finish. Hints of cocoa and coffee, a little dry overall. A little thickness, but not too creamy. Very nice.

Poured from a bottle. Pours a dark cola color. Rich aroma of toasted malts and toffee. Smooth taste that reminds me of an expresso. Hints of coffee and chocolate linger on the palate. Overall, a great stout.

Bottle:
Pours fizzy, cola-black with a dark tan, cascading head.
Chocolate, oatmeal and a dash of cinnamon in he aroma.
Taste is lightly bitter, coffee....cream, chocolate malt..a bit of smokiness.
Very smooth and filling.....slightly thin feel, but rich and robust despite the lightness.
Very tasty.....I could drink these everyday.

Poured from bottle. Little lacing and the head vanished in a couple of minutes. Kind of a burnt toffee and coffee aroma. The coffee came through a bit more in the taste. Nice carbonation and very smooth. Decent beer, still prefer the Rogue oatmeal though. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
pours black with a nice tan head. Aromas of coffee, dark chocolate and some treacle. taste is similar with a nice rich smooth mouthfeel. very nice stout.

341ml bottle. Pours jet black with thick tan head decent lacing. Aromas of espresso, roasted malt, chocolate. Tastes of bitter chocolate, espresso, toast. Light carbonation smooth lasting bitter finish. Very good, and only 11cdn for a six pack.
Bottle from Melbourne Street Fine Wine Cellars. Nice sweet aroma, not overpowering. Mild burned chocolate. Light sweet taste. Nice!
Malty butter run aromas. Light tan head and flat black body. Buttery alc flavors and light roasty notes and minor caramel notes. Smooth and crisp on the palate.

Aroma of roast coffee with hints of oatmeal. Dark brown and almost opaque in colour. 
Taste: slight roast coffee with very little oatmeal
Finishes slightly sour
Overall fairly well balanced stout with slightly less oatmeal than expected.

Une de mes meilleures stout. Cremeuse et velouté. Une biere au gout de blé caramelisé. Pas sucrée genre chocolaté. légerement torréfié. Cest une excellente biere qui accompagne les viandes fumées a merveille.
341ml bottle. Black with a frothy tan head. Flavors are toffee, roasted malts, coffee, vanilla, bread, dark chocolate and licorice with herbal notes. Medium body, soft carbonation, smooth texture.

The St. Ambroise Oatmeal Stout pours black with a nice thick brown head that lasts a good while. The aroma is chocolate and espresso and the flavor follows suite pretty accurately. This is a good solid oatmeal stout. This is very smooth and easy to drink. Overall this is a solid beer.

Very flavourful stout. Roasty aroma with some hops on the nose. Really roasty, almost burnt, malt taste, some espresso, tobacco, and a bit of cocoa. I really like the role the hops play in the taste of the beer, bringing a nice bitterness and some citrus notes. Surprisingly low alcohol (and calories, if youre counting) for how tasty it is.

Bu en bouteille de 33cl, une couleur noire et un petit col mousseux, grosse explosion caramélisée en bouche qui reste très longtemps et ensuite attaque sur les noix, noix de macamamia et le grillée, énorme !
Bottle. Deep black with a thin tan head. Aroma is vanilla chocolate malt. Flavor is deep roasted malt, chocolate, dry burnt finish with a long ash palate.
bottle, merci jaghana! Deep black, beige head. Chocolate nose with coffee. Medium-bodied, sry start with cocoa powder, bitter chocolate and espresso coffee. A dark delight.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2014 Now this is a stout!! By far my favourite stout and second only to Samuel Smiths in the stout category in my book. Where to begin... this beer explodes with flavour but keeps the sweetness in check. Pours a dark charcoal/black colour with an excellent body and head. Notes of roasted malt, chocolate and espresso are evident but not overbearing. Perfectly balanced.

Bottle from 16 Tons Taphouse, Eugene. Pours a near opaque dark black-brown, decent Amount of quickly dissipating tan head, lots of lacing. Aroma bittersweet chocolate, candi sugar, oatmeal. Body full and lively with a crisp, oat forward finish. Grassy and tannic, yet smooth. Totally get the hype.

One of my fav stouts on the market right now!! Bottle. Pours a midnight black color about half a finger of brown head. Nose is burnt coffee and roated malts. Taste is mainly coffee and dark chocolate with a nice hop bitterness. Has a nice vanilla finish. One of the best!
Noire avec une mousse beige persistante. Céréales grillées, chocolat. Cémeuse en bouche, une bonne amertume. Un bel équilibre. Bon prix !!

Une bière riche et lourde. Elle est noire opaque, pas de place pour la lumière autrement que dans nos esprits ! Un goût de chocolat noir et de café, dirigeant le sucré que lavoine ajoute à cette bière. Un jolie collet épais surplombe le liquide quelque peu "creamy". Un classique, une référence.

Bottle. Pours a dark black color with a small tight java colored head. Nose is burnt coffee and very sweet oatmeal. Taste is coffee, chocolate and sweet oatmeal but rather light. Drinks rather easily, with a light oatmeal, subtle vanilla finish. Quaff Sc ore 7 / 10

Pours black with a brown head and aroma of sweet oatmeal and roasted malt. Taste is light, sweet oatmeal notes come up with coffee and chocolate following leading to a burnt, sweet oat finish. Solid stout

Stouty stouty stoutness. I do love a stout. I get an inordinate amount of satisfaction from a stout and this seems like a good exemplar. 
Its as black as sin this one with a mocha coloured head. The aroma is beautiful: chocolate, coffee (especially) and cocoa. Even my mother in law was captivated and took a bigger drink than I expected she would, which pleased me greatly. Tart bitterness arising from the coffee flavour but lengthening into cocoa charm. What a beauty.
More please.

Best stout beer in all of Quebec, maybe the whole damn country of Canada (actually, I like Canada, wouldnt live so close if I didnt). Flavor, texture, and color (or lack of it, if white is all colors) all first-rate. If you dont like super creamy beers, you might actually prefer this over Guinness!
bottle at home. Nice appearance, good nose of molasses and creamed corn. thin but oily, chocolate and a touch of cardboard. coffee lingering. pretty solid.

Pours black with a bubbly, cappuccino-colored head that dissipates slowly. Generous lacing. Nose is somewhat like burnt toast with notes of malt. Taste is thin and slightly bitter. Surprisingly thin body, soft carbonation, somewhat astringent finish. Im not particularly impressed. Good, but not excellent.

Aromas of butterscotch, coffee, caramel, dark chocolate, and some toffee, some butter as well. Black with a lasting tan head. Dry, bitter, roasty with hints of molasses. Very smooth, creamy, full bodied.

Robe noire impénétrable surmontée dune mousse beige persistante et collante. Un bouquet de céréales grillées et de chocolat pénètre le nez, ça sent très bon! Légèrement crémeuse en bouche, une douce amertume à la fin vient rehausser le goût prononcé de chocolat au lait. Un bel équilibre et un excellent produit pour sinitier aux stouts.

Aroma : very rich maltiness. Smokey character with chocolate and espresso notes

Taste :rich flavors with a smokey aftertaste. Some oatmeal notes aswell . Subtle and smooth bitter finish.

Appearance : Dark body with light brown head that had somewhat little retention
Black pour, tan milkshake head. Roasty aroma, creamy milk chocolate flavor. Way too creamy for my tastes. Maybe its just me, but it was a little over the top on that front in my opinion.
From a 33 cl bottle shared at home. Pours black with tan head. Luscioius aroma of toffee. Flavors of licorice, toasted oats and a bit of chocolate. Bitter finish.

Pour is pitch black and topped by a medium beige head that leaves really good lacing. Aroma is of chocolate, cold coffee and a little ash. Taste is sweet but also slightly acidic with flavors that conform to the nose. The ashy character is not overwhelming at all and just reinforce the roasted impressions. Body is medium, mouthfeel really thin for an oatmeal stout. None or close to none of that silky oat mouthfeel. Good beer, a classic.
Bottle at Pivo, Oulu. Originally rated 06012012. Colour is almost black with small head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, chocolate and roasted malts.

Bière noire comme la nuit, totalement opaque, effervescence très difficile à observer mais qui semble bonne, et surmontée dun bon col brunâtre, mousseux et dense, et qui se réduit tranquillement en laissant une belle dentelle sur les parois du verre. Arômes de malt torréfié (chocolat noir, café) et un peu de malt grillé (mélasse, caramel), avec des houblons floral et herbacé, de la levure terreuse, du malt fumé et une pointe de vanille. Nez assez complexe, mais également un peu standard pour une stout, et aussi un peu timide. En bouche, cest un peu pétillant sur la langue, un peu mousseux également, avec une bonne onctuosité au palais, rondeur intéressante. Au goût, le chocolat noir amer domine, avec des notes de café et dexpresso. Les houblons sont également bien présents en bouche, apportant une amertume moyenne, et on peut percevoir certaines pointes de fumée et de vanille. Il sagit dune très bonne bière, ses saveurs sont intenses, mais elle manque quelque peu de complexité, et je préfère personnellement mes stouts un peu plus sucrées, et un peu moins amères.
Pours a dark black with a thin tan head. Aroma is of malts and chocolate. Tastes like malts, oatmeal, dark chocolate. Smooth, delicious. A fantastic stout.

Pours black licorce dark with a two finger fluff cap. This is a fatastic cap that serves as a lesson is texture & sustain. Taste is all balance: muted, rich flavourful. An all around world class brew.

Liquide épais, bien noir et opaque, col de mousse chocolatée sur le pourtour du verre. En nez, chocolat au lait, vanille et un peu de café. Les saveurs demeurent dans ces mêmes notes en bouche, alliant celles-ci à un côté velouté exquis, avec les malts qui séternisent en fin de gorgée. Le stout de référence au Québec, qui prend du corps, et des arômes de caramel, en se réchauffant. Toujours excellente, même si plusieurs brasseurs depuis son inception il y a 25 ans ont réussi des délices plus poussés.
Couleur noire et mousse brune. Nez de café grillé et malt. Gout fort de café et malt grillé, limite fumés, mais fin de bouche douce de café chocolaté leger. Peu de carbonation.

Good oatmeal taste with a slight bite at the end. On draft at Morris tap and grill

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Olfactif: Des notes de terre, de fumée , de chocolat au lait, de vanille, de tabac. Nez très complexe et de très bonne puissance.
Visuel: Noire, opaque, mousse généreuse, onctueuse, crémeuse, dense et persistante. Elle colle bien et laisse une petite dentelle éphémère. 
Gustatif: Lattaque se fait surtout dans les accents de café, avec une finale très sèche soutenue par des houblons amérisants. Les saveurs se situent dans les notes de café et de chocolat à la base, tout en développants des subtilités de vanille et de tabac. En bouche, sa texture se situe entre aqueuse et huileuse et son équilibre malt / houblon est très efficace. Une stout savoureuse et bien équilibrée qui satisfera autant les amateurs damertume de torréfaction que de houblon.

Almost black with a dark brown head. Cocoa and coffee aroma. Dark roasted coffee flavor with an even more intense espresso finish, like that last sip with just a bit of grounds in it. Now thats a stout!

11.5 oz bottle. The pour is brilliant. Oily black with a thin dark khaki head that reduces to a film, leaving some light lace. The aroma is heavy in chocolate and oatmeal. There are light tones of coffee and roasty malt. The roastyness and chocolate dominate the lead on the taste. The flavor morphs through a nice coffee tone and then the oatmeal sits nicely on the finish. The mouth feel is a little thin, but it holds well. Great stout 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

11.5 ounce bottle from Total Wine Sacramento, aroma is nutty, with some grain. Palate is dry, no sweetness, roasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
The best stout on the market. Well-balanced flavour with the oatmeal complimenting the hops perfectly. Pours with an excellent head.

Bottle from the Beer Store. Pours a deep black with a generous dark beige head that clings to the glass. Nose is lots of coffee and caramel and chocolate with a good helping of roasted oats. Great balance of sweet chocolate and bitterness from the hops. Mouth is rich and creamy with a good level of carbonation. Thoroughly enjoyable.
Bottle from LCBO. Great example of the style. Thick, creamy, chocolate with wonderful coffee notes. Nice balance of malts and hops. Really enjoyed this!

Pours a deep black with generous tan head. Aroma is black coffee, with hints of caramel and cereal. Taste is all about roasted malts. I sipped this through closed teeth, half expecting to encounter shards of coffee beans. Slightly sweet. Terminates with a mild bitterness. Mouth feel is somewhat oily, carbonation medium. Pretty fine lacing. Final remark: amazing value!
Dark as night, aroma of coffee and chocolate, creamy head, slightly sweet, great mouth feel- can almost chew the oatmeal; terrific example of the style
The only negative comment I have is that I donT like the colour of the head...other than that this brews a gem!!! Wonderful

great stout! easy drinking. flows very well nicely equilibrated. nice white head, black body. nose is caramel, chocolate, burnt grain. lightly carbonated, mouth feel is great. one of my favorite stouts

Pours a jet black with 1-2 finger head. Aromas of cocoa, coffee, and roasted malts. Creamy mouth feel. Taste is bitter dark chocolate, coffee, molasses, hops, and roasted cocoa beans. Nice bitter finish. Pretty darn tasty!

Black pour, tan milkshake head.
Roasty aroma, creamy milk chocolate flavor. Way too creamy for my tastes. Maybe its just me, but it was a little over the top on that front in my opinion.
Very black beer with chocolate head. Creamy smooth, slightly sweet. Very layered roast flavors. Yum.
Beautiful beer, tasty you can taste that this beer has been made well, slight coffee taste on the palate
Yep. I think this is a pretty good beer. Very tasty and I think I would get this beer again.
Nitro. It tastes like I would imagine a caramel infused coffee would, smooth and rich,

Bottle. Black with a mocha head, good retention and some lacing. Aromas of dark chocolate, fruit cake, oats and plenty of roasted malt. Similar flavours of dark chocolate, fruit cake, roasted malt and toffee, oats and a touch of vanilla. Nice beer.

11.5 ounce bottle into pint glass, no bottle dating. Pours pitch black color with a 1-2 finger dense dark tan head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass. Aromas of big cocoa, dark chocolate, molasses, raisin, dark bread, vanilla, toast, roasted malt, toffee, oats, floral, and toasted earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of dark/roasted malt and oat notes with moderate dark fruits; and good strength. Taste of cocoa, dark chocolate, dark bread, toast, vanilla, toffee, molasses, raisin, oats, light coffee, floral, and roasted earthiness. Light earthy roasted bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, dark bread, light coffee, toast, molasses, vanilla, toffee, raisin, floral, and roasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Awesome balance, robustness, and complexity of dark/roasted malt flavors with moderate fruitiness; with zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light-medium carbonation and medium bodied; with a very creamy and moderately slick mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is a highly excellent oatmeal stout! All around great balance, robustness, and complexity of dark/roasted malt flavors with oat and dark fruit notes; with great robustness and very smooth drinking. A highly enjoyable offering.
Draft. Black with a thin tan head. Prototypical oatmeal stout in taste and aroma. Nice silky palate. Solid and drinkable.
Bottle. Dark pour. Thick creamy head. Taste of dark malts and coffee. A little vinous quality as well.

Deep espresso, english toffee malt and skunky black patent malt aroma. Pure black appearance with a thin foam. Odd, foreign black malt dominates the palate. Other notes of toffee, mocha, soy sauce, and burnt resin hit the tongue. Overall, not too impressed with this one. Very funky/odd overtones. Ive had better Canadian Ales. C rating.

5 sept 2013, bottle. Black. Nose is bitter dark chocolate and toasted oatmeal. Thin body and fizzy. Acidic, burnt toast. Decent 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: (As noted) strong notes of espresso with dark chocolate. Its not an overly complex nose, but its rather inviting. Appearance: Thick, oily black pour with ample mocha head up front which dissipated into a thin skin of mocha with bubbly patches. Flavor: Like an espresso beer, but with a very authentic coffee flavor- never comes off like an artificial additive. The flavor starts off very lively, but finishes more on the smooth chocolate side of things. Palate: Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation, abrupt finish. Overall: A lovely, accessible stout. Has a real feeling of purity and nuance that gives it a quiet beauty.
Bottle. Espresso pour with a finger of head. Coal, coffee, licorice. Medium body with almost silky and smooth bubbles. Slightly bitter and acidic finish but very well balanced. Very good

Pours black with a fine tan head. Aroma of licorice, chocolate, toast, and a bit of molasses. Taste is initially nicely malty-sweet, leading to chocolate, coffee, toast, and slight herbal notes. Not too sweet, making this a perfectly balanced stout, and quite substantial with medium-low carbonation and a big body for the abv.
Smells like burnt toast and dark roast coffee. Poured nice and dark. Nice coffee finish. Will drink again.
Hahaha dark Amber pour. Burnt toast. Thick. Burnt roast. On a mission to bring some back. Choc noise
En fût au bistro L'Autre Œil. Noire. Mousse crémeuse. Azoté. Nez de café. Bouche. Onctueuse. Malt rôtie. Légèrement sucré bien balancé avec la fine amertume. Chocolat au lait. Délicieuse.

Bottle @ home, courtesy of weihenweizen. Thanks! Pours a black appearance with a brown head. Anise, earthy, dark chocolate, mild coffee, a bit raisin aroma. Fairly roasty, moderately smoky, burnt chocolate malty, milk sugar, ashy, mild coffee flavor. A lot of ash and anise notes. Finishes fairly dry. Doesnt blow my mind but pretty good.

Pour out of 12 oz bottle, thanks a ton Aaron! Dark black pour with creamy tan head, aroma brings notes of caramel, toffee, nice lactose, lots of dark chocolate, roast, coffee, unlike most stouts Ive smelled. Taste is a mix of lots of lactose, smoke, roast, hints of burnt coffee, touch of chocolate, finishing with ashy and burnt tobacco notes, slightly oaky. Interesting, the finish on this kills it, but overall pretty tasty.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2013 Pours dark dark brown. Strong coffee/espresso nose. This is a great beer! Smooth with a slightly bitter finish.

Bouteille de 341 ml versé dans une english pint

Dans le verre, la bière se présente sous un noir profond couronnée dune belle couche de mousse. Au nez, cest le pain rôti et le café qui sexprime avec une touche de malt. Aussitôt en bouche, cest le pain rôti qui domine tranché sec par un café noire. Le café laisse tranquillement sa place au malt brûlé qui sétire longuement en amertume. Excellente oatmeal stout. Classique et délicieuse.
I just believe this is the perfect beer. I recommand it and I think the St.Ambroise is the best in the Oatmeal Stout category.
Bottle. Black pour with brown head. Full aroma of coffee and malt. Lekker flavour, coffee, chocolate, oat and malt. Pleasant malty finish with a bit of chocolate
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text: "Woah. Nice looking beer. Extremely dark brown appearance with a thick, foamy brownish head. Aroma is of roasted malts, cocoa, and some spices, cant quite put my finger on. Bottle. Near black with one if the darkest heads I've seen. Sweet brown sugar, raisins and coffee. Very malty.

Pours black with a mocha head. Bold scent of coffee and dark chocolate. Very nice bitterness that isnt too overpowering, but compliments the sweetness brought up from the oats and dark chocolate very nicely. Finishes pleasantly bitter with a bold, but not to overpowering espresso aftertaste. This beer is a thing of pure beauty, everything came together very well, and a marvelous beer was created. One of the finest Ive had.

Une bonne bière noire, pas trop forte, au goût de café et chocolat noir. Doux en bouche. Excellente, je vais reboire

Ketail

Bottle in St. Ambroise taster (LCBO). 5%. Beautiful dark brown pour with a fairly weak tan head with mild lacing. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, malts. Taste is oaty, thick, rich, with a hint of chocolate. Superb.
Bottle.  Pours heavy black with some beige head. Aroma of coffee, raisins, cocoa. Taste of vanilla, raisins, malt. Thin for a stout, but I enjoyed drinking this beer.

best value stout around- no question. the pour is perfection- black body with two fingers of dense tan foam... i get so much creaminess from this beer- its like having an icecream... a tasty, roasted malt icecream

Black pour with medium sized tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, espresso and cocoa. Taste is predominately roasted malts with espresso and unsweetened chocolate coming through. Fairly dry finish with slight bitterness. Full bodied and a very long finish.

Poured from bottle that Ive held on to for probably too long now, pours black with a thin head,  aroma is sweet with a decent amount of chocolate and sweet malt, the flavor has a nice coffee front end with a sweet chocolate finish, nice thick mouthfeel, good stuff.

Bière noire de 5% dalcool. Elle possède un long col au versement. Elle est très goûteuse et possède comme un goût de café, de torréfaction forte et amère, un peu comme du chocolat noir. Elle possède un odorat de café. Très bonne bière froide !

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours black with a short 2cm of disappearing khaki head, medium lacing. Nose is espresso, oats and cocoa, mostly savoury. Taste is lots of roasted malt, touch of vanilla, soy, raisins and cocoa. Not super rich flavours, thinner body than anticipated but as far as a sessionable stout goes, this has to be up there.
UPDATED: MAY 18, 2013 Pours black and semi thick. Not too much of a head. Great smell. Rich coffee taste. Hints of chocolate. Great stout!

2013/05/09 - Pours an opaque brown (cola-like) with a creamy tan head that laces nicely. Aroma is oats, coffee and slight chocolate. Taste is similar to nose, but slightly metallic with a lingering bitter cocoa aftertaste. Mouthfeel is medium and oily with more carbonation than expected and a drying finish. Good but not great.

Rich aroma. Pours a deep rich color. It has a pleasant chocolate and malt taste. The only flaw is its a little watery. I wish it was richer and a bit more complex.

A - A big bubbled mocha head sits on top of a black body. Specs of lacing left behind.

S - Rich chocolate mousse, intense vanilla. Very sweet aromas.

Wow the nose is awesome for an oat stout! The taste doesnt quite deliver like the aroma. Something seemed to be off in the flavor which brings down drinkability.

12-23-2010
Bottle shared with northropfrye. I smell and taste a lot of oatmeal in this. Theres no sweetnesser at all, but mostly oatmeal, Im pretty tired. I put your soup in the freeezer.

Thanks, Tommy. Finally had a chance to try this Quebec classic. Dark body with creamy brown lasting head and loads of lacing. Sweet malty dried fruit aroma. Taste is sweet raisins, grapes, oatmeal, nuts, milk chocolate. Very nice stout.

Bouteille 341ml. De couleur noire et opaque. Nez de café, de chocolat noir, de malt rôti aux notes brûlées, avec des notes de mélasse douce, de houblon herbeux ainsi que des traces de réglisse noire. Moyenne-ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture riche et crémeuse. Goût de chocolat noir légèrement amer avec de faibles traces fruitées et de réglisse noire dès lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute rapidement un goût de malt rôti aux notes brûlées, de café mocha avec des notes de mélasse ainsi que quelques traces de caramel toffee et de fumée (tourbe, fumée de bois) puis une légère amertume de houblon herbeux vient compléter la gorgée. Post-goût long et très légèrement sec, léger-moyen amer de rôti, de chocolat noir, moyen de café avec des notes de houblon herbeux. (2006)

Bottle.  Poured a black color with generous head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee bean, cocoa, slight vanilla. Above average carbonation. Light bitter, light sweetness.  Slightly creamy texture. Pretty smooth. Little bitter through to the end.  Not bad.
Smell like chocolate. Nice dark color. Taste is nice at first, but end a bit like cold coffe...

Goodness, glory be. Everyone I shared this with agreed it was the beer to behold. A creamy, pillowy head that has great retention, off-white in color. A delicious beer with lots of texture and malt, roasted complexities. Not to be missed!

Black with dark tan foamy head. Aroma is caramel, dark malts, choc milk. Taste is bitter! followed by *very* muted flavours of caramel; roast wins the day. Surprising given aroma. Palate is clean finish of bitterness, but not excessive lingering. Overall, a great oatmeal stout, but perhaps not smooth or creamy enough for my taste.

Une excellente Stout !
D'un noir profond avec une mousse dense et persistante couleur caramel. C'est déjà en soi un régal pour les yeux. 
Des arômes puissant de café, malt grillé, moka et réglisse viennent égailler le nez avec plaisir. Une attaque douce et délicate qui laisse place à une rondeur savoureuse. L'amertume est légère (elle aurait peut être méritée d'être plus marquée) et ne reste pas très longtemps en bouche. Retour sur le biscuit. 
J'y reviendrais !!!

Bottle courtesy of AirForceHops. Sweet caramel, lactic chocolate aroma. Black with a large brown head. Roasty malt, caramel, mocha, earthy oat, and slightly smoky flavor. Medium to full creamy body, soft carbonation. Very nice.
Was never a fan of stouts before trying this on a friends recommendation. Has 100% turned my opinion around. Highly recommend

St. Ambroise Oatmeal Stout has a rather thin, tan head and a very dark brown (black, really) appearance, with a good amount of lacing left behind on the glass. The aroma is just wonderful- rich, sweet, bready, candy-like malts are all there. Taste is of quite bitter, dark-roasted malts, dark chocolate, dark coffee, and some sourness. Mouthfeel is surprisingly light and somewhat watery, and St. Ambroise Oatmeal Stout finishes dry, refreshing (if you can believe it), and drinkable. This is a fabulous beer, and I insist that you try it! RJT
A beautiful beer to behold with deep brown color and big cocoa colored head.  Sweet malts in the nose.  A bit thin for a stout, would like it to be chewier.  Sweetness in the taste for sure.
Even darker and richer than might be expected. Terrific balance of all the usual stout aromas and tastes with none predominating.
Tasted in 2009 (backlog). Black in color with an average sized tan head. Aroma is light vinegar, dark fruits, and chocolate. Taste is oats, light vinegar, roasted malts and chocolate.

Nice pint pour of deep dark almost black with plenty of tan head.  Nose is roasted malts and sharp oatmeal notes.  Also comes through with some notes of dark chocolate.  Flavor is somewhat bitter with dark coffee and dark malts, almost burnt flavor... Lighter body than I may have liked, but quite drinkable.  

Side note: according to the girlfriend, this is fantastic due to the fact that its Canadian, much like her.  Thank you.

Pours black with a huge creamy thick head that lasts the entire beer. Aroma of roasted malts, chocate and coffee. Taste is roasted malts, chocolate & a coffee and cream taste given from the oatmeal. Very creamy Mouthfeel to this beer gives it the complete experience. Exceptional oatmeal stout.

Verry good ! Beau col et ronde en bouche! Rappelle l'odeur et le gout du grain de café et tout sa delicieuse amertume!

330 ml bottle. Pours black with beige coloured head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate with some smoke.  Taste is very similar to the aromas, but with a stronger smokiness and bitter finish that lingers.  Relatively smooth mouthfeel.  Would definitely drink again.

Pours a deep solid black with a tight tan head. The nose shows a deep coffee aroma with some chocolate and a little smoke. More coffee comes through with some dark fruits and a little burnt sugar. Theres also a light smoke tinge and a mild astringency. The finish is remarkably clean. Delicious.

en fut dans un pub dun noir et avec une belle mousse tres cremeuse qui dure des odeur de cafe et malt torrifier nous monte au nez.En bouche  un bon cafe doux et cremeux avec torrification peu carbonisation bonne bieres de 5a 7 (rate 36)

Poured from a 330 ml bottle. Pours black with coffee coloured head. Aroma of chocolate and small amount of smokiness. Chocolate and coffee flavours with an earthy taste to follow. Kaatuu lasiin sysimustana ja melkein colanvärisellä isolla vaahdolla. Haju on paahteinen, mutta hedelmäisen raikas, myös karamellia ja suklaata löytyy. Kokonaisuutena erinomainen kaurastout, joka on monipuolinen ja raikas sekä yllättävän lievästi paahteinen.
Aroma of dates, figs, chocolate and really dark coffee.  Pours black with white head.  Taste is roasty with dark coffee, peat and slight molasses.  Light mouthfeel and very dry.  Good stuff.
Bottle at Hop & Vine in North Burnaby. Pitch black with a tan head. Sweet on the nose. The taste is of coffee and chocolate, with substantial bitterness noted. A very nice stout.
Poured from a 12 ounce bottle. Smokey, chocolate, roasted malts, slight sourness, fruity, berries. Tasty stout, very complex, very well balanced.

Dark pour with a huge head.  Lots of lace.  Aroma is light with a little roast.  Some sugar.  Medium mouth.  Very easy drinker but I didnt find it to be overly flavorful or complex, which is probably why this is a good stout.  Some chocolate but very dry overall.  A practice in moderation here.

Dark with strong flavour but very smooth and drinkable. Probably my favourite stout.

Incredibly full body with a dark, refreshing finish. The taste is fairly bitter and contains hints of espresso, while staying not too malty. Relatively soft carbonation, but it adds to the body.
With an aroma that sends chills down ones spine, and an aftertaste like good coffee this is highly recommended for the stout lover.
Belle couleur noir, généreuse mousse qui dure. Dentelle. Forte odeur de café torifié. Goût acre avec un café.

33 cl. bottle split with Kraddel. Purchased @ the Christmas market in Brussels. Black but not like the darkest black, bubbly mocha head which is more inclined to stick to the sides.  Smell is sweet mocha, creamy chocolate & coffee, cacao, quite a bit of unpeeled nuts  the whole feels a  bit thinned out, could be the lower alcohol percentage and is probably that but I keep thinking; age. Taste is hazelnut, coffee, unpeeled nuts, cacao, that fake health store coffee, light dark fruits, herbs, light bitter herbs in the back. Bottle. Pours pitch black with a large creamy beige head that slowly dissipates with great lacing. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee, chocolate milk and tobacco. Flavor is about the same, light to medium sweet with a light coffee bitterness on the finish. Body is a bit light, but is creamy. Pretty nice beer.

Bouteille 341 ml. Servie dans une pinte anglaise. Il est facile de voir doù vient lexcellente réputation de cette bière, à partir du moment où on est mis en contact avec ses notes de chocolat et de café. Très bonne bière.

Bottle from LCBO, this beer pours jet black with a picture perfect mocha head. The aroma is overflowing with chocolat, coffee, oatmeal, and molasses. The taste is much the same, great notes of chocolate, espresso, oatmeal, and a pleasant hoppy bite to round it all out. The only downfall I see is the carbonation, it seems to be a tad to carbonated.
